thread.title: Jan Moffatt's life after her husband tried to kill her: Family, school, gratitude
thread.title_full: Jan Moffatt's life after her husband tried to kill her: Family, school, gratitude | OregonLive.com

author: Everton Bailey Jr. | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Jan Moffatt's life after her husband tried to kill her: Family, school, gratitude
text:
Jan Moffatt now lives with her son in Oregon City and goes to a counselor to deal with what happened to her when her husband chased her down and shot her four times, then turned the gun on himself.
Â» Read Jan and Tim Moffatt's story
She misses her husband every day and said she forgives him because she doesn't believe he was in his right mind when he attacked her in January.
She and the couple's two children spread some of Tim Moffatt's ashes at Walton Lake in central Oregon in July. Her husband had taken her trout fishing there in 1979 for their third date. He told her if he died, he wanted his ashes left there.
She has twice met with the woman who helped her that day and has thanked her each time.
"She said she doesn't feel like a hero. She said she was just glad to be there to help," Jan said. "But I consider her a hero because she took the time out to help me and I'll always appreciate that."
She spends her days with her three dogs and that helps keep her spirits up. She's closer to her children, she said. She has since begun taking classes at Mount Hood Community College.
-- Everton Bailey Jr.
ebailey@oregonian.com
